description.narrative: Output 2.4: Early Childhood Care & Educationâ€œNational capacity to provide formal and non-formal early childhood care and education services for more vulnerable children is strengthened, with support from UNICEF.â€, which contributes to Early Childhood Development. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Survival and early developmentBy 2022, more vulnerable children in their early years (aged 0 to 6) have improved survival and are nurtured and stimulated for improved early childhood development.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 2.4: Early Childhood Care & Education“National capacity to provide formal and non-formal early childhood care and education services for more vulnerable children is strengthened, with support from UNICEF.”

description.narrative: In support of improving access to and quality of formal and non-formal early childhood education services for vulnerable children in the governorates that host refugee children, UNICEF supported the provision of education grants and educational materials, school renovation, teacher training and play-based learning activities. Through these efforts, a total of 7,550 refugee KG students improved their learning achievement in a protective environment. Further, additional 333 education personnel benefited from trainings that enhanced their capacity to adapt and improve their teaching approaches and contributed to the national capacity to provide vulnerable refugee pre-primary school students with a better learning experience. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:08/12/2019
